label: 448. Madame Baptiste to Bp Patrick Lynch -- December 30, 1866
description: Madame Baptiste writes to Bishop Patrick Lynch about soliciting funds for the convent and academy.  She asks the Bishop for the addresses of the Visitation Convent in Paris and Empress Eugenie, who have sent aid to other American convents in the past, writing "we can do nothing more in this country." December 30, 1866. 4p.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value: A. M. D. G. Ursuline Convent & Academy--. Valle Crucis [,,?]-- near Columbia S.C. Sunday 30th Dec. 1866. My dearest Brother, How do you feel this intensely cold weather--? We have had a heavy fall of snow-- every thing looks as in Ohio-- the roofs of the houses with a heavy coat of beautifully white snow-- the trees & landscape in [general?], looking beautifully pure-- & we with our [Comfortably?] fire within listening to the sleet as it rattles against the windows--. But how I pity the suffering poor who have not a sufficiency of food & Clothing-- & not even a comfortable shelter. Our "Lord tempers the wind to the shorn Lamb"-- & I hope they Know how to make their [merit?] of their privations & sufferings. I wonder if you are preaching today-- it is now-- near Eleven OClock-- I hope you will have a good Collection also to begin the year with, or [written on side of page:] Little Sallie [illegible] has just heard from her mother-- whose infant is very low-- her Sister seems delighted with the [illegible] of [Lan-?],[End Page 1] rather to Conclude the old year--. I am beginning to look around for more bedsteads & single mattresses to suit-- we have had applications or talk of three Pupils beside little Ellis-- viz -- Miss Hagood of Barnwell-- Miss Simmons of Augusta-- & you Know about Miss Bonneau of Charleston of whom Miss [Cunningham?] wrote. I will send Mr Devereux of Raleigh our [reduced?] circulars when out-- I enclose our terms for your inspection & approval, & will be very much obliged if you will write me your answer at your earliest convenience as others are awaiting my reply--. Please give me if you can too, the address of the person in Paris to whom I should address myself about the loan-- Perhaps Mr [illegible] B. Lafitte could be of some assistance in that matter-- It was the Visitation Convent of Paris that loaned the Ursulines of B.C. the money they used in building,-- & Sr Etiene will be very much obliged for the address of Empress Eugenie[End Page 2] to whom the Visitation Nuns of Mobile applied, & who sent them a donation-- (we hear a handsome one)--. We, can do nothing more in this Country, so must try elsewhere-- What about Jones--? He might as well return his papers to you & find some other employment than living off us--. I'm tired of [him?],-- the mean fellow--! You will be pleased to learn that we have heard again from Tuscaloosa, & our Sisters write very satisfactorily-- They have secured servants for next year-- sr Josephine has had a chill since we left, but was better-- do pray for them & especially for health for Sr J-- if it be A.M.D.G. We have recd a very pleasing letter from Miss Nannie Nicholson whom we expect at any time-- & another from [illegible: Sister?] Frances whose visit is deferred for a few weeks-- we think they will both remain with us-- nothing from the Lay Sr Postulant but hope she will come-- When may we expect the pleasure of seeing you-- & what about our building--? Don't forget Confirmation of Children -- & to give Rev Dr the [illegible] to erect [stations?] properly--.[End Page 3] I did not intend to write on this page, but when I begin to talk to you, I never Know when to stop. All join me in very aff. & grateful respects & wishes of a "Happy New Year & many joyous returns, with the means of giving great glory to Almighty God-- I will not give you any family news-- as no doubt you hear as often as I do-- Anna & Francis have both written to me--. & I am truly thankful that our dear Parents continue so well--. How the sleet patters against the glass--! God bless you my dearest Brother-- Take good care of Yourself-- Give to us all your Benediction-- especially to-- Your own Sister Ellen. Sr Baptiste. Sup. This is my 3rd or 4th letter since my return. But I don't expect an answer to [half?].[End Page 4]
